title: Sr Network Engineer
description:
Invitae is a leading medical genetics company trusted by millions of patients and their providers to deliver timely genetic information using digital technology. We aim to provide accurate and actionable answers to strengthen medical decision-making for individuals and their families. Invitae's genetics experts apply a rigorous approach to data and research, serving as the foundation of their mission to bring comprehensive genetic information into mainstream medicine to improve healthcare for billions of people.

**About our team:**



Our mission is to provide all connectivity required by our employees to bring genetics into mainstream medicine, and ensure that our office's IT environment is reliable, and highly available.



The Networking team's responsibilities range from WAN, LAN and DC, embracing cross-team collaboration across Security, Engineering, IT, Cloud Operations and End user support teams.


**Responsibilities:**


* Contribute to the design, build, and support for all facets of our new offices and on-prem build outs.
* All things related to networking: implementation and maintenance for a variety of cloud based network technologies.
* Able to support our internal customers and provide exceptional support
* Work closely on initiatives and convert them into requirements for the team.
* Creating and defending High/Low Level Design documents, working with internal stakeholders to influence technology roadmaps.


**Technical Requirements:**


* A track record of network greenfield implementations, from the inception to post deployment support.
* Understanding of physical infrastructure design including structured, fiber-optic cabling.
* Expertise in Juniper switching (Virtual Chassis, MC-LAG), Cisco Switching (VPC, VSS, Switch Stacking) and PAN-OS (Palo Alto Networks firewalls and Panorama - virtual and physical), wireless.
* Proven experience managing multiple projects simultaneously and delivering against mission critical deadlines.
* Monitoring tools integration experience: Slack, Webhooks, Logic Monitor, Juniper Space and Palo Alto Networks Panorama.
* Working knowledge of Storage architectures to collaborate with Data Center Storage Infrastructure teams and VMware environments.
* Network Stack: Juniper, Palo Alto Networks, Mist, Cisco and Meraki, SD-WAN appliances.


**What you bring:**


* 5+ years of experience in TCP/IP networking;
* Expertise in TCP, IPv4/6, OSPF and BGP;
* Proficient familiarity with Cisco CLI ( IOS-XE, NX-OS), Junos and PAN-OS;
* Troubleshooting network issues in an environment with Windows, VMWare, Pure Storage, Vast Storage and an array of Bio-Medical laboratory systems;
* Open to travel for work, approximately 10-15%;
* Expertise in configuring and troubleshooting routing and switching protocols (BGP, OSPF, STP, VRRP).
* Understanding of network protocols (TCP/UDP, DHCP, DNS) and experience with IPv4 and IPv6.
* Linux experience to troubleshoot the life of a packet from client to server, packet captures, tracing, etc;
* Proficiency with Network Automation is a huge plus.

This salary range is an estimate, and the actual salary may vary based on a wide range of factors, including your skills, qualifications, experience and location. This position is eligible for benefits including but not limited to medical, dental, vision, life insurance, disability coverage, flexible paid time off, Spring Health, Carrot Fertility, participation in a 401k with company match, ESPP, and many other additional voluntary benefits. Invitae also offers generous paid leave programs so you can spend time with your new child, recover from your own illness or care for a sick family member.**California Pay Range**


$105,200—$131,500 USD
Please apply even if you don't meet all of the "What you bring" requirements noted. It's rare that someone checks every single item, it's ok, we encourage you to apply anyways.



Join us!


*At Invitae, we value diversity and provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.*  

  

*We truly believe a diverse workplace is crucial to our company's success and to better serve our diverse patients. Your input is especially valuable. We'd greatly appreciate it if you can take a quick moment to make your selection(s) below. Submissions will be anonymous.*



You can find a detailed explanation of our privacy practices here.

title: Network Engineer - Remote
description:
Company Name: ARS-Rescue Rooter Overview:

At ARS, our Network Engineers support a wide range of data communication hardware, software, and cloud-based connectivity. This person works with several groups to design, build, and support the on-prem and cloud infrastructure, implement software features, research innovative solutions, and provide necessary maintenance and troubleshooting. This person specifies, configures, installs, troubleshoots, upgrades, and administers WAN/LAN hardware and software, cloud connectivity and integrations, and various monitoring tools.
Responsibilities:
* Strong knowledge of Cisco and/or Meraki hardware and management software on a mid to large size network.
* Experience with Fortinet or Cisco firewalls and their associated features
* Strong knowledge of IP routing protocols including BGP and EIGRP
* Strong knowledge of IP addressing including CIDR, supernetting and subnetting.
* Experience with NMS software and technologies (SNMP, NetFlow, Syslog, etc)
* Solid understanding of voice and data wiring and communication protocols.
* Knowledge of cloud-based connectivity options and integrations with major providers
* Must have excellent troubleshooting skills and be able to diagnose complex network problems.
* Ability to take ownership of an issue, problem, or project and see it through to completion.
* Must be a teamwork oriented, self starter who can effectively manage their own project schedule and deadlines with minimal supervision.
* Ability to learn new technologies rapidly and adapt to industry changes on a consistent ongoing basis.
* Clear, concise, and understandable verbal and written communications with customers, vendors, and IT staff. Ability to communicate technical information in a non-technical manner.
* Ability to adjust schedule appropriately to manage multiple, changing priorities as well as emergencies.
* Understanding of current industry trends, directions, and products.
* Provide a high level of customer service.
* Manage WAN/LAN infrastructure.
	+ Assist in architecting the WAN/LAN infrastructure
	+ Regularly monitoring system usage, capacity and availability.
	+ Develop and execute procedures for optimizing WAN/LAN performance and capacity.


Qualifications:
* At least three years of experience administering a medium to large scale LAN/WAN and Hybrid-cloud environment
* High-school diploma or general education degree required.
* College degree in computer-related science or Cisco certifications preferred.
* This position is remote; excludes WA, CO, and CA applicants.

**ARS-Rescue Rooter is an Equal Opportunity Employer AA/EOE/M/F/V/D. In compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act, ARS-Rescue Rooter may provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities and encourages both prospective and current employees to discuss potential accommodations with the employer.**

title: Network Engineer - Remote
description:
CareDx, Inc. is a leading precision medicine solutions company focused on the discovery, development, and commercialization of clinically differentiated, high-value healthcare solutions for transplant patients and caregivers. CareDx offers products, testing services, and digital healthcare solutions along the pre- and post-transplant patient journey, and is the leading provider of genomics-based information for transplant patients.


 In the role of Network Engineer- remote, you will support the operation of our global network environment. The position is responsible for network maintenance, operation, and security. The service level requirements are high with a growing 24x7x365 lab operation. The requirements of the network are growing, and this role will provide input for network technology direction, development and support.  

  

**Responsibilities:**

* Support network capabilities for resiliency, performance, and scale in a complex, evolving environment.
* Implement, support, maintain and monitor routers, switches, firewalls, IPSec VPN tunnels, wireless access points, and IDS/IPS devices for stability, reliability, scalability and compliance.
* Implement and support network (WAN//LAN/SD-WAN) traffic analysis to diagnose and resolve issues for preventative maintenance.
* Develop and maintain detailed documentation of network equipment including routers, switches, firewalls, intrusion prevention systems, etc.
* Evaluate emerging network technology for security, monitoring, performance, reliability, and resiliency.
* Maintain awareness of regulatory and compliance requirements for network operations in a laboratory and patient care environment, meeting standards including HIPAA, CLIA, NIST, and others.
* Review and enhance internal network security procedures. Develop and maintain metrics to measure security program effectiveness.
* Monitor network performance, capacity, and tuning of related network components.
* Act as the point of escalation for all network related issues and facilitate troubleshooting and communication related to network issues/outages/escalations.
* Provide escalation support for critical network problems.
* All other duties as assigned by management.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Management Information Systems, Engineering, or related field a plus.
* 5-7 years in Networking with knowledge of server and desktop technologies.
* Experience in a healthcare regulated environment dealing with CLIA, HIPAA, and FDA requirements preferred
* CCNP, CCIE, PCNSE or other applicable certifications.
* Industry and vendor specific certifications and training (Cisco, Meraki, Aruba, etc)
* Working knowledge of ticketing systems – Examples: ServiceNow, Atlassian.
* Experience with Palo Alto, FTD, and FortiGate firewalls and VPN configurations, Aruba SD-WAN, Prisma Access, Meraki devices, Cisco Catalyst and Nexus switches, NAC, AAA, and RADIUS.
* Experience in networking technologies: IPv4/IPv6, BGP/OSPF, VPN, L2 switching, VLANs, VLAN aggregation, EtherChannel, PVLANs, Spanning Tree & Rapid Spanning Tree, 802.1Q.
* Demonstrated experience with high availability and performance networking environments.
* Demonstrated experience with networking across mixed on-prem, private cloud, and public cloud infrastructures.
* Experience with networking in highly virtualized environments and elastic compute infrastructure.
* Experience with network monitoring tools such as SolarWinds.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Management Information Systems, Engineering, or related field a plus.
* Experience in a healthcare regulated environment dealing with CLIA, HIPAA, and FDA requirements.
* CCNP, CCIE, PCNSE or other applicable certifications.
* Industry and vendor specific certifications and training (Cisco, Meraki, Aruba, etc)
* Working knowledge of ticketing systems – Examples: ServiceNow, Atlassian.

**Additional Details:**

*Every individual at CareDx has a direct impact on our collective mission to improve the lives of organ transplant patients worldwide. We believe in taking great care of our people, so they take even greater care of our patients.*


Our competitive Total Rewards package includes:

* Competitive base salary and incentive compensation
* Health and welfare benefits including a gym reimbursement program
* 401(k) savings plan match
* Employee Stock Purchase Plan
* Pre-tax commuter benefits
* And more!


In addition, we have a Living Donor Employee Recovery Policy that allows up to 30 days of paid leave annually to a full-time employee who makes the selfless act of donating an organ or bone marrow.

*With products that are making a difference in the lives of transplant patients today and a promising pipeline for the future, it’s an exciting time to be part of the CareDx team. Join us in partnering with transplant patients to transform our future together.*

*CareDx, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer and participates in the E-Verify program.*

*By proceeding with our application and submitting your information, you acknowledge that you have read our* *U.S. Personnel Privacy Notice**and consent to receive email communication from CareDx.*


\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\* We do not accept resumes from headhunters, placement agencies, or other suppliers that have not signed a formal agreement with us.=

title: L3 Aruba Wireless Engineer (VA, Remote + Travel)
description:
Request Title: L3 Aruba Wireless Engineer  
Desired Start Date: 3/25/2024  
Duration: 5 Months, Hrs/Wk:40.00  
Work Location: Richmond, VA (Remote + Travels)

Description:

This role will be for an L3 Remote based, US resource. **There will be required travel for surveys**, etc. The role will be **30-40 hours weekly** variable based on workload (expect more in the 35-40 hour range)  
Overview:  
The Senior Wireless Network Engineer must be a detail oriented, committed problem solver with robust communication skills who will execute the vision through the design and oversight of a web and mobile application platform. Responsible for setup and installation of technical systems, applications, or process designs for client’s purchased or outsourced technology and business process solutions. Works directly with client to manage initial access, map and transfer data, create process documentation, and train or coordinate training for client users. Tests and troubleshoots functionality of installed systems; identifies and documents technical issues to be escalated to product and system integration teams for resolution. Provides feedback based on client experiences to product and professional services teams for product and process improvements. **Experience working for a Global multi-national corporation**. **MUST have Highly skilled with performing on-site Wireless survey s for AP placement.** 

**Must have strong experience with Aruba Wireless and Ekahau Sidekick 2 survey tools**

Required Experience:  
1. **Must have 8-10 years of experience in specification, design, development, and deployment of digital wireless networks and communication systems** inclusive of :  
o Wireless Pre-Design Site Visit, Wireless Predictive Design, Wireless Post Installation Survey, & APoS Surveys.  
o **Knowledge of 802.11 standards, CAPWAP, Cisco WLC**; be able to use tools such as **Cisco Prime Infrastructure, AirMagnet Spectrum, Ekahau Pro, or other Survey and RF tools**, to design and support WLANS.  
o Interact with clients on site to meet complex requirements of a solution.  
o Escalate unresolved problems and issues to the relevant third parties.  
o Respond to escalated client requests and support client applications to a first line resolution.  
o Escalate complex problems to the relevant third parties.  
o Write reports and proposals and complete and maintain project documentation.  
o Assist with the documentation of standard operating procedures relating to installations and fixes.  
2. **Expert understanding of Aruba Wireless Network architecture, design, configuration, and operations is required.**  
o **Extensive practical knowledge of switching and routing protocols** (**OSPF, BGP, and EIGRP**).  
o Solid understanding of general Network and Security fundamentals.  
o Remotely supporting clients within service level agreements (SLAs),  
o Install and Configure software and hardware as well as resolve incidents,  
o Perform root cause analysis and adhere to any related processes such as change management.  
o Device and network performance analysis and troubleshooting skills  
3. Strong oral and written communication skills.  
4. Ability to lead technical discussions (internally and externally with vendors).  
5. Demonstrated technical success in a fast paced, results-oriented engineering environment.  
6. Ability to work independently, and **mentor others**.  
7. Possessing active certifications like: **HPE Aruba Certifications, CCIE Wireless, Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) Wireless or Certified Wireless Network Professional (CWNP), is a strong plus**.

\\*  
\\*  
\\*  
\\*

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $70.00 - $75.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Work Location: Remote

title: Sr. Lead, Network Engineer
description:
**Values & Innovation**
-----------------------


At Under Armour, we are committed to empowering those who strive for more, and the company's values - Act Sustainably, Celebrate the Wins, Fight on Together, Love Athletes and Stand for Equality - serve as both a roadmap for our teams and the qualities expected of every teammate.

  

Our Values define and unite us, the beliefs that are the red thread that connects everyone at Under Armour. Our values are rallying cries, reminding us why we're here, and fueling everything we do.

  

Our pursuit of better begins with innovation and with our team's mission of being the best. With us, you get the freedom to go further - no matter your role. That means developing, delivering, and selling the state-of-the-art products and digital tools that make top performers even better.

  

If you are a current Under Armour teammate, apply to this position on the **Internal Career Site Here.**

**Purpose of Role**
-------------------


The Sr. Lead Network Engineer will be responsible to provide subject matter expertise on the design, implementation, and operational support of the UA global network. This role will primarily be focused on supporting the Under Armour Distribution house, corporate, retail, cloud, and datacenter environments.

**Your Impact**
---------------

* Lead the architecture and technical decisions of global infrastructure environment for specified area(s) with a focus on reliability, scalability, performance, and security.
* Architect, design, and support key integrations of cloud services within Azure, AWS and others
* Demonstrate the capability to lead and spearhead the delivery of strategic projects and operational tasks with precision and predictability.
* Leverage experience and latest technology developments in the creation and execution of strategic roadmaps aligned to overall business objectives.
* Present, augment or create business case proposals with recognition of future key initiatives.
* Demonstrate strong leadership, communication, and presentation skills.
* Demonstrate and model advanced troubleshooting for critical escalations.
* Manage, identify, and execute escalation for resolution/communications within all support tiers.
* Demonstrate expertise in managing relationships with large global vendors and partners.
* Vision and ability to create overall strategic lifecycle management of global infrastructure.
* Maintain and test disaster recovery for all critical business network infrastructure.
* Define, document and communicate network standards and processes.
* Provide peer review on all changes and designs.
* Mentor junior IT teammates and partners
**Qualifications**
------------------

  

* Bachelor’s Degree preferred and\\or 10+ years of experience managing complex network environment using Cisco and cloud technologies.
* Network tools and automation experience.
* Experience managing complex network environment: SD-WAN, cloud firewall, on-prem firewall, network access control, wireless environments, AWS\\GCP cloud networking.
* Cisco CLI for LAN, firewall and wireless
* Cisco Wireless
* Cisco ISE
* SilverPeak SD-WAN
* AWS\\GCP Networking
* Zscaler NextGen cloud firewall
* Python
* Ansible
* Automation
**Workplace Location**
----------------------

* **Location:** **Fully Remote**
* **Return to Work Designation:** **Fully Remote**
* **Travel:** **10%**
* **Licenses/Certifications:**
	+ **CCNP required, CCIE preferred (or equivalent knowledge\\experience)**
	+ **AWS Advanced Networking (or equivalent knowledge\\experience)**
	+ **Google Professional certification (or equivalent knowledge\\experience)**
**Relocation**
--------------

* No relocation provided
**Base Compensation**
---------------------


 $143,606.00 - $197,458.80 USD


Most new hires fall within this range and have the opportunity to earn more over time. Initial placement within the salary range, however, is based on an individual's relevant knowledge, skills and experience for the position. UA is committed to helping our teammates succeed and advance in their careers. Base salary is only one component of our competitive Total Rewards package.

**Benefits & Perks**
--------------------


Paid "UA Give Back" Volunteer Days: Work alongside your team to support initiatives in your local community.

* Under Armour Merchandise Discounts
* Competitive 401(k) plan matching.
* Maternity and Parental Leave for eligible and FMLA-eligible teammates
* Health & fitness benefits, discounts and resources- We offer teammates across the country programs to promote physical activity and overall well-being.

  

Want more details about benefits? Visit our page **here**

**Our Commitment to Diversity**
-------------------------------


At Under Armour, we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, family or paternal status and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Under Armour believes that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success as a global company, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. Accommodation is available for applicants with disabilities upon request.

title: Network Engineer I
description:
We are a hybrid, remote-office company dedicated to growing our talent anywhere!



We have onsite locations in: Sioux Falls, SD, Scottsdale, AZ, Troy, MI, Franklin, TN, Dallas, TX



At Pathward, we take tremendous pride in our purpose to create financial inclusion for all™. We are a financial empowerment company that works with innovators to increase financial availability, choice, and opportunity for all. We strive to remove barriers that traditional institutions put in the way of financial access, and promote economic mobility by providing responsible, secure, high quality financial products.



We are a team of problem solvers and innovators who celebrate our differences and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger and well-positioned for success. We celebrate, and embrace, our team members through our **\\*HUMBLE\\*HUNGRY\\*SMART** approach, and we believe that we are strongest when we embrace the voices of our employees, customers, partners, and the communities we serve.

***Please note that this role requires the Network Engineer to be onsite at the Pathward Scottsdale, Arizona office at least once a week.***


**About the Role:**



Responsible for advanced problem resolution of LAN, WAN, Security, network and availability redundancy. Provide maintenance and repair of equipment and products, new hire training/mentoring by providing expert technical recommendations based on business needs. Prepare technical reports concerning status of activities, new technology testing and create thorough documentation.


**What You Will Do:**


* Configures and maintains the corporate enterprise network environment, including configuration, coordination, control, troubleshooting, security, usage monitoring, and the development of specialized procedures relating to the configuration and use of network equipment.
* Performs analysis, diagnostics, and resolution of complex network and voice problems, which may include coordination, installation, configuration, testing, maintenance, monitoring, and troubleshooting.
* Monitors the reliability of the network across multiple platforms.
* Participates in the rotating "on call" schedule with other members of the team in order to provide support to the business and partners.
* Performs root cause analysis for network outages or other business impacting issues.
* Provides primary and secondary support for key network and infrastructure applications, ensuring objectives are met while maintaining defined security standards.
* Assists in designing, configuring and the implementation of major network systems.
* Conducts research and evaluates new industry hardware and software to stay current on emerging technologies, market trends, and future expectations in order to make hardware and software product recommendations. Assist in the configuration and implementation as directed.
* Maintains system documentation and departmental procedures.
* Performs user ID creation, ID removal and ID maintenance for employee access changes; perform user ID access reviews and account cleanup processes.
* Manages the day-to-day operation and troubleshooting of the enterprise data communications networks, including the repair of all network-based equipment; may also include application, desktop and server support.
* Completes trouble tickets and provides customer feedback.
* Other duties as assigned.


**What You Will Need:**


* Bachelor's degree or equivalent education and work experience.
* Up to 2+ years with bachelor's or equivalent..
* Functional/Technical Skills
* Action Oriented
* Customer Focus


*The responsibilities listed above are not all inclusive and may be changed at any time.*



Salary range: $47985.10 – $88,620.90



The salary range reflects the minimum and maximum target for a new hire in this role. Individual pay within the range will be determined by multiple factors which can include but are not limited to a candidate's experience, qualifications, skills, and location. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary for your location during the hiring process. Ranges may be modified in the future.  

This role is also eligible for an annual performance-based incentive opportunity. Pathward offers a comprehensive benefits package for eligible employees, including health insurance, 401(k) retirement benefits, life insurance, disability benefits, paid time off, and more.

You may be just the right candidate for this or other Pathward roles.***

Our commitment to inclusion is woven into our DNA. We believe that we are strongest when we embrace the voices of our employees, customers, partners, and the communities we serve.

title: Lead Network Engineer - RapidScale
description:
**RapidScale** is one of the fastest growing Cloud Computing companies in the industry. Based in Raleigh, NC, the company has a solid track record of delivering world class products and services to our customers located throughout the country and around the globe. RapidScale is seen as a leader in desktop virtualization with marked success in application virtualization for both Windows and Mac applications. The company also provides Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), and Disaster Recovery as a Service (DRaaS) solutions via an enterprise "Flex Pod" cloud stack.  

  

**JOB SUMMARY:**  

  

The Lead Network Engineer's role is to ensure that RapidScale/industry best practices and methodologies are applied to design, deployment and operations of core route/switch and data center networks. This individual provides technical guidance and leadership to the customer and project management team and ensures project timelines are being met. They will be the technical point of contact for the customer and provide design, migration and deployment guidance.  

  

The Lead Network Engineer will work as part of a team that provides design, architecture, and migration planning for new customer projects. The role is responsible for leading all the technical efforts to successfully migrate a new customer into the RapidScale platform. The Lead Network Engineer will be responsible for providing migration support, which includes advanced troubleshooting, architectural design, and management of overall health of services migrating into the RapidScale managed cloud. The role is responsible for providing support to junior Network engineers on an escalation basis. The position will be a key factor in providing a great customer experience pre & post implementation.  

  

**TECHNICAL SKILL REQUIREMENTS:**  

  

Network:  

* IPv4, IPv6
* VLANs
* VPNs (IPSec configuration/troubleshooting)
* QoS
* Subnetting
* NAT
* Port translation
* Spanning tree
* LACP, port channeling, and VPCs
* HSRP
* BGP
* OSPF
* RIP
* VMware VeloCloud products
* Fortinet products
* Cisco Meraki products
Cradlepoint products  
* 

  

  

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:** (Essential Duties include but are not limited to):  

  

* Responsible for the delivery of network planning, design, implementation & optimization services as a post sales consultant to clients.

  

* Create Low Level and High-Level design of data center networks utilizing industry best practices and Cisco hardware to include: Cisco enterprise level L3 switching and Nexus 7K/5K/2K platforms.

  

* Lead the delivery of network solutions including routers, switches, firewalls, load balancers and other network hardware appliances including VMWare VeloCloud.

  

* Oversee/perform new and existing equipment, hardware, and software upgrades.

  

* Perform installation, configuration, maintenance, and troubleshooting of customer managed hardware, software, and peripheral devices.

  

* Monitor network performance and troubleshoot problem areas as needed.

  

* Conduct research on network products, services, protocols, and standards to remain abreast of developments in the networking industry.

  

* Provision new customers and provide onboarding assistance.

  

* Provide support on escalated trouble tickets when necessary.

  

* Review entire environment and execute initiatives to reduce failures, defects, and improve overall performance.

  

* Document architectures, procedures, and processes for use by other engineers and support.

  

* Create documentation for Support desk to use and remediate issues on first call.

  

* Provide assistance to junior network engineers when escalated to.

  

* On-call support is a requirement of this position.

  

**Qualifications**  

  

**Minimum:**  

  

* Bachelor's degree in a related discipline and 6 years' experience in a related field. The right candidate could also have a different combination, such as a master's degree and 4 years'experience; or 10 years' experience in a related field
* 6 years of experience designing, deploying, and implementing core route/switch and/or data center networks in accordance with industry best practices.
* Passionate, collaborative, results oriented capable of inspiring and building cross functional high performing relationships to effectively drive change while achieving established goals.
* Ability to form strong cross-functional relationships and influence others to ensure that business initiatives are achieved.
* Exceptional level of skill in both oral and written communications and the ability to effectively present ideas and information.
* Experience with logical network design models (L2/L3, WAN, Network Optimization, Spanning tree, VFR, VTP, VLANs, physical cabling).
* Working technical knowledge of network control protocols (QOS, PfR, PoE, NTP, DHCP), network management protocols (CDP, FTP, TFTP, SNMP) and security protocols (SSH, HTTPS, AAA, IPSec).
* Experience with Cisco ISE (Identity Services Engine), as well as Trustsec desired.
* Working technical knowledge of advanced Layer 2 technologies (LISP and VXLAN)
* Knowledge of IP communication and routing is required (OSPF, EIGRP, BGP).
* Understanding WAN/LAN and transport technologies (Ethernet, Frame Relay, DMVPN, WAAS and MPLS).
* Experience with large-scale WAN deployments.
* 5 or more years' experience working in WAN (Wide Area Network)
* SD-WAN (VeloCloud & Fortinet) implementation and migration experience required.
* Firewall experience with managing Fortigate, Cisco, Meraki, and Palo Alto required.
Certifications in CCNA, CCNP, or Fortinet NSE required.  
*

title: Senior Network Engineer - RapidScale
description:
**RapidScale** is one of the fastest growing Cloud Computing companies in the industry. Based in Irvine, CA, the company has a solid track record of delivering world class products and services to our customers located throughout the country and around the globe. RapidScale is seen as a leader in desktop virtualization with marked success in application virtualization for both Windows and Mac applications. The company also provides Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), and Disaster Recovery as a Service (DRaaS) solutions via an enterprise "Flex Pod" cloud stack.  

  

**JOB SUMMARY:**  

  

The Senior Network Engineer's role is to ensure that RapidScale/industry best practices and methodologies are applied to design, deployment and operations of core route/switch and data center networks. This individual provides technical guidance and leadership to the customer and project management team and ensures project timelines are being met. They will be the technical point of contact for the customer and provide design, migration and deployment guidance.  

  

The Senior Network Engineer will work as part of a team that provides design, architecture, and migration planning for new customer projects. The role is responsible for leading all the technical efforts to successfully migrate a new customer into the RapidScale platform. The Senior Network Engineer will be responsible for providing migration support, which includes advanced troubleshooting, architectural design, and management of overall health of services migrating into the RapidScale managed cloud. The position will be a key factor in providing a great customer experience pre & post implementation.  

  

**TECHNICAL SKILL REQUIREMENTS:**  

  

Network:  

* IPv4, IPv6
* VLANs
* VPNs (IPSec configuration/troubleshooting)
* QoS
* Subnetting
* NAT
* Port translation
* Spanning tree
* LACP, port channeling, and VPCs
* HSRP
* BGP
* OSPF
* RIP
* VMware VeloCloud products
* Fortinet products
* Cisco Meraki products
Cradlepoint products  
* 

  

  

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:** (Essential Duties include but are not limited to):  

  

* Responsible for the delivery of network planning, design, implementation & optimization services as a post sales consultant to clients.

  

* Create Low Level and High-Level design of data center networks utilizing industry best practices and Cisco hardware to include: Cisco enterprise level L3 switching and Nexus 7K/5K/2K platforms.

  

* Lead the delivery of network solutions including routers, switches, firewalls, load balancers and other network hardware appliances including VMWare VeloCloud.

  

* Oversee/perform new and existing equipment, hardware, and software upgrades.

  

* Perform installation, configuration, maintenance, and troubleshooting of customer managed hardware, software, and peripheral devices.

  

* Monitor network performance and troubleshoot problem areas as needed.

  

* Conduct research on network products, services, protocols, and standards to remain abreast of developments in the networking industry.

  

* Provision new customers and provide onboarding assistance.

  

* Provide support on escalated trouble tickets when necessary.

  

* Review entire environment and execute initiatives to reduce failures, defects, and improve overall performance.

  

* Document architectures, procedures, and processes for use by other engineers and support.

  

* On-call support is a requirement of this position.

  

**Minimum:**  

  

Bachelor's degree in a related discipline and 4 years' experience in a related field. The right candidate could also have a different combination, such as a master's degree and 2 years' experience; or 8 years' experience in a related field  

  

* 4 years of experience designing, deploying, and implementing core route/switch and/or data center networks in accordance with industry best practices.

  

* Passionate, collaborative, results oriented capable of inspiring and building cross functional high performing relationships to effectively drive change while achieving established goals.

  

* Ability to form strong cross-functional relationships and influence others to ensure that business initiatives are achieved.

  

* Exceptional level of skill in both oral and written communications and the ability to effectively present ideas and information.

  

* Experience with logical network design models (L2/L3, WAN, Network Optimization, Spanning tree, VFR, VTP, VLANs, physical cabling).

  

* Working technical knowledge of network control protocols (QOS, PfR, PoE, NTP, DHCP), network management protocols (CDP, FTP, TFTP, SNMP) and security protocols (SSH, HTTPS, AAA, IPSec).

  

* Experience with Cisco ISE (Identity Services Engine), as well as Trustsec desired.

  

* Working technical knowledge of advanced Layer 2 technologies (LISP and VXLAN)

  

* Knowledge of IP communication and routing is required (OSPF, EIGRP, BGP).

  

* Understanding WAN/LAN and transport technologies (Ethernet, Frame Relay, DMVPN, WAAS and MPLS).

  

**Preferred:**  

  

* Experience with large-scale WAN deployments preferred.

  

* 2 or more years' experience working in WAN (Wide Area Network) is desired.

  

* SD-WAN (VeloCloud & Fortinet) implementation and migration experience desired.

  

* Firewall experience with managing Fortigate, Cisco, Meraki, and Palo Alto required.

  

* Certifications in CCNA, CCNP, or Fortinet NSE desired.

  

USD 97,100.00 - 161,800.00 per year

title: Principal Network Engineer
description:
**\\*\\*100% remote role, candidates can reside anywhere in the contiguous United States\\*\\*\\***


**Communication Technology Services (CTS)** is building a next-gen (4G & 5G) managed service business to provide enterprise customers with a turnkey **Private Wireless Network (PWN)** for mission critical business applications and wireless connectivity needs.


**We are driven by the desire to solve complex customer problems, the excitement of deploying new technologies, and our dedication to provide complex wireless network solutions to customers that enable CTS to fulfill our customer promise of “your network, your data, your rules.”**


The **Principal Network Engineer’**s role is to design and build new network architectures required to support Local Area Network (LAN), WiFi, Cellular, and Private Wireless Network (PWN). This is achieved by planning, designing, and developing LANs and Wireless Networks across the organization and as requested by our customer base. In addition, the Principal Network Engineer will participate with the installation, monitoring, maintenance, support, and optimization of all network hardware, software, and communication links. This individual will also analyze and resolve network hardware and software problems in a timely and accurate fashion, and provide end user training.


**If you are ready to apply your skills in engineering carrier-grade cellular networks, this role is for you!**


**Principal Network Engineer**


**Responsibilities**


**Strategy & Planning**


* Collaborate with department heads as well as customers to assess near- and long-term network capacity needs.
* Create and maintain documentation as it relates to network configuration, network mapping, processes, and service records.
* Develop, implement and maintain policies, procedures, and associated training plans for network administration, usage, and disaster recovery.


**Acquisition & Deployment**


* Design, deploy, maintain LANs, WiFi, Cellular, and PWNs, including servers, routers, hubs, switches, firewalls and other hardware.
* Conduct research on network products, services, protocols, and standards to remain abreast of developments in the networking industry.
* Oversee new and existing equipment, hardware, and software upgrades.
* Interact and negotiate with vendors, outsourcers, and contractors to secure network products and services.


**Operational Management**


* Configure networks to ensure their smooth and reliable operation for fulfilling internal and external customer objectives and processes.
* Monitor network performance and troubleshoot problem areas as needed.
* Oversee installation, configuration, maintenance, and troubleshooting of end user hardware, software, and peripheral devices.
* Monitor and test network performance and provide network performance statistics and reports.
* Perform server and security audits, and system backups and recovery as needed.
* Support the training and operational needs of the national team and the Network Operations Center in their efforts to increase our LAN, WiFi, Cellular, Private Wireless Network MMRD program.


**Requirements**


**Know****ledge & Experience**


* Proven experience and success with LAN, WiFi and Private Wireless Network design and implementation.
* Proven experience with network capacity planning, network security principles, and general network management best practices.
* Mobile Core, RAN, Wi-Fi 6, LTE, 5G, private networks, CBRS, RAN, EPC, Virtualization, software defined networks, ORAN, NFV, MEC, OSS/BSS, MANO Experiences are Preferred
* Excellent hardware troubleshooting experience.
* Good understanding of the organization’s goals and objectives.
* Knowledge of applicable data privacy practices and laws.
* Highly self-motivated and directed, with keen attention to detail.
* Able to effectively prioritize tasks in a high-pressure environment.
* Strong customer service orientation.
* Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
* Flexible for up to 30% travel to customer sites


**Formal Education & Certification**


* Bachelor of Science / Bachelor of Engineering degree (higher preferred) and a minimum of 15 years related experience.

title: Network Engineer - End to End
description:
About us:

One team. Global challenges. Infinite opportunities. At Viasat, we’re on a mission to deliver connections with the capacity to change the world. For more than 35 years, Viasat has helped shape how consumers, businesses, governments and militaries around the globe communicate. We’re looking for people who think big, act fearlessly, and create an inclusive environment that drives positive impact to join our team.
What you'll do:

As an End to End Network Engineer, you will use customer feedback to recommend design or re-design, develop, test, and implement changes to Viasat Mobile Terminals and Viasat SATCOM Network customers operate on. You will also provide technical, network, and software support/expertise to customers, testing applications, responding to customer feedback, installations, maintenance and assist Business Units in development of sales presentations by providing technical expertise and customer feedback. Additionally, you will work multi-functionally with the other engineering teams, sales teams, customer service teams, and the manufacturing teams.


The day-to-day:

You will be charged with assisting in the design, development, and implementation of applications and Viasat products, develop plans, designs and standard methodology implementation for the ground infrastructure network solutions using multiple platforms and protocols. You will support and fix network issues, and coordinate with vendors for installation of items such as routers and switches while working on project implementation, perform a variety of project management functions including handling vendors, scheduling, billing discrepancies, license management, audits, cost analysis, and vendor comparisons. Additionally, you'll analyze customer issues and recommend changes that respond to customer needs and provide innovative solutions to common problems and perform software/hardware piloting, application tests, and document reviews to ensure product is satisfactory.

  

From service start-up through the warranty period and post warranty, the Network Engineers provide customers with ongoing technical support including addressing issues, assisting with installs, and working with the various cross-function teams. The engineer will also perform duties which accurately detail customer issues and may require development changes.


What you'll need:
* 5+ years' hands-on experience in Satellite Communications industry, specifically working with SATCOM, RF, networking, and wireless communications
* Proven SATCOM Network experience with configuration, installation, maintaining and/or integration background
* Experience in networking, internet, and UNIX systems administration
* SATCOM/RF theory experience and how it pertains to mobile platforms
* Bachelor’s degree in relevant technical field or equivalent experience.
* US Government position. US Citizenship required
* Active Secret Clearance or active within the last two years
* Active Security+ certification or ability to gain within 6-months of employment
* Must be willing and able to work a rotating on-call schedule
* Ability to travel up to 20%


What will help you on the job:
* 5+ years' experience of installation and staging of RF/SATCOM networking equipment
* Firm grasp of Viasat's Ka networks and mobile terminals (E2E)
* Working knowledge of the OSI model.
* Shows ease of use with Linux/Unix Commands
* Experience with Active Directory, Domain Services, Windows Server, and RHEL Enterprise
* Experience with Military SATCOM systems or Commercial Aircraft SATCOM systems
* Experience with Virtualization technology (VMWare, KVM, VDI, HyperV)
* Proficiency with network monitoring protocols and tools such as SNMP, Wireshark, Cacti, Kentik, and Tivoli
* Active PCEP/PCAP certification (Python)
* Experience with Splunk queries and dashboards
* MySQL/SQL experience
* Cisco, Palo Alto, and/or Fortinet experience
* Validated ability implementing AAA devices (E.g., ISE, TACACS, Radius, etc.).


Salary range: $104,900.00 - $182,400.00 / annually : At Viasat, we consider many factors when it comes to compensation, including the scope of the position as well as your background and experience. Base pay may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Additional cash or stock incentives may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered. Learn more about Viasat’s comprehensive benefit offerings that are focused on your holistic health and wellness at careers.viasat.com/LifeAtViasat/Benefits. EEO statement:

Viasat is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, genetics, age, or veteran status or any other applicable legally protected status or characteristic. If you would like to request an accommodation on the basis of disability for completing this on-line application, please click here.

title: Cybersecurity Network Services Specialist
description:
NikSoft Systems Corporation is a recognized Information Technology solutions provider. Founded in 1998 and based in Reston, Virginia, NikSoft is a CMMI Level 3 Certified company with an established reputation for excellence and on-time delivery with a consistently high customer satisfaction rating from its Federal Government and private consulting contracts.

  

NikSoft is currently conducting a search for a **Cybersecurity Network Services Specialist** to add to its team in support of the United States Postal Service's Cybersecurity program. The successful candidate will experience an unparalleled large-scale enterprise environment with over 800 Information Technology systems, 10s of 1000s of servers and desktop devices, processing billions of dollars in annual revenue and supporting a diverse user base spread across the entire US. Join the NikSoft team to scale your career to the next level.

 **Responsibilities:**

* Provide security requirements for the infrastructure teams to enhance the security posture of the network.
* Conduct investigations to identify security gaps present in the current network and network services.
* Investigate new or improved security solutions and develop solutions to mitigate known security gaps.
* Develop and document CISO security solutions.
* Represent CISO Engineering to internal and external stakeholders.
* Conduct training on topics related to the network services security tools.
* Develop dashboards and reports to support CISO needs, using SIEM, tools portals, other monitoring tools.
* Support change management process

 **Qualifications:**

* 5 years of cybersecurity experience
* Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Systems, Cybersecurity or other related field. Or equivalent work experience.
* Knowledge of security standards and best practices, including but not limited to:
	+ DISA STIGs,
	+ NIST 800, Cybersecurity Framework
	+ CIS Benchmarks
* Knowledgeable in cybersecurity technology solution planning, engineering, and deployment, including DNS, FW, EDR/XDR, FW, NGIPS, SIEM.
* Knowledge of enterprise infrastructure components: Data center, Cloud (Azure, GCP, AWS, PaaS/IaaS/SaaS), Software defined networks/SASE, Trusted Internet Connections (TIC), Enterprise certificate authority/PKI operations, DNS/DHCP security, DDoS/WAF, Network access control, Wireless network security.
* Ability to work well in a collaborative team-oriented environment.
* Ability to effectively present technical information to different levels of the organization.
* Demonstrated strong communication skill (written/spoken).
* Demonstrated strong organizational skill.
* Proficiency on Microsoft Office tools: i.e., O365, PowerPoint, Visio

 **Desired Qualification:**

* Experience in large enterprise environment
* Scripting / Programming language experience.
* One or more of the following certifications: CISSP, Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH), CCIE, CCNP

 **\\*\\*\\*\\*Candidates must be able to obtain a Postal Sensitive Clearance (US Citizenship or Green Card required). Additionally, candidates must not have traveled outside of the USA for a combined period not to exceed 6 months within the last 5 years.**

title: Engineer 3, Network
description:
As we continue to build our team in support of our vision to the be the world’s best and most trusted mobility company, Enterprise Fleet Management, an affiliate of Enterprise Mobility is excited to announce the opening of an Engineer 3, Network in our IT Department!  

Enterprise Fleet Management is a privately held, full-service fleet management business for companies, government agencies and organizations with medium-sized fleets. With more than 60 fully staffed offices nationwide, our team of experts can assemble a customized or full-service fleet management program that is just right for each business. With a North American fleet of 680,000 vehicles and growing at almost 15 percent, the opportunity with Enterprise Fleet Management is tremendous. Our business continues to thrive, and we remain committed to the investment in and the development of our people. We do the right thing by our customers and employees every time and in every situation. Not only is that great for business (as seen in our global growth and success) it’s also great for employees.  

Enterprise Fleet Management Information Technology (EFM IT) provides streamlined and effective solutions to serve our growing operation. We offer solid architectural platforms with a strategic focus that clearly aligns to business growth and improving the customer experience. Being a member of EFM IT offers all the advantages of a smaller shop including the opportunity to shape a more progressive architecture. Professionals who effectively navigate change and readily wear many hats will find this an opportunity to maximize skill diversity and build broad IT experience.  

Business growth is driving the need to add high-level network engineer skillset to the IT team. This unique position is an exciting new opportunity to develop, implement, and mature the network and technology footprint that will help take EFM to the next level. The ideal candidate will have solid experience working on LAN/WAN/WiFi/Cloud network infrastructures. The primary focus for this role will be network infrastructure engineering which supports all data and cybersecurity of the EFM network.  

As an Engineer 3 you will use your technical knowledge of professional concepts to solve business problems. You will serve as a subject matter expert in your area of focus and represent the department on complex assignments. You will evaluate elements of technology’s effectiveness through requirements gathering, testing, research and investigation and make recommendations for improvements that result in increased stability and lower downtime.

  

In this role, you will work as a network solutions engineer in support of our Wide-Area Network (WAN), Local Area Network (LAN), and Cloud (Azure and AWS). Typical technologies include IP routing, VLANs, switching, load balancing, Firewall, VPN, WAF, WAN access, Voice over IP, and wireless technologies across a variety of network platforms.

  

This opportunity will be remote with the opportunity to work at our office located at 2281 Ball Drive, Maryland Heights, MO 63146 on an as needed basis.

  

Enterprise Fleet Management offers a comprehensive healthcare package, 401k matching & profit sharing, paid time off, great discounts, and organizational growth potential.

 **Responsibilities:**  

* Evaluate, design and modify elements of our technology's effectiveness through requirements gathering, testing, research and investigation and making recommendations for improvements that result in increased quality and effectiveness
* Create and maintain documentation for elements of our technology and provide instruction and guidance to other members of the team
* Listen to and evaluate Network Solutions’ customer needs to determine expectations and needs and provide solutions that align with them
* Monitor key performance metrics to ensure compliance of established standards, processes, and procedures
* Protect our customers, our employees, and our brands by incorporating security and compliance in all decisions and daily job responsibilities; following security policies and procedures

*Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veterans*

 **Qualifications:** **Required:*** Must currently reside in the St. Louis Metropolitan area
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Management Information Systems, or related field **OR** equivalent work experience
* Must be committed to mitigating cybersecurity risks in all decisions and daily job responsibilities
* 5+ years’ of Network Engineering experience
* Must have previous experience with:
	+ Configuring/administering LAN/WAN/MAN communications and network hardware such as routers, switches, VPN, firewalls, and load-balancers
	+ Configuring routing protocols and BGP
	+ Documenting Network design using Visio-like tools
* Must have proven experience in routing and switching in large, complex, high-availability networks
* Must have recent network design experience or strong network configuration experience
* Must be presently authorized to work in the U.S. without a requirement for work authorization sponsorship by our company for this position now or in the future
* Participate in on-call rotation and perform evening and weekend maintenance

**Preferred:*** Previous experience with:
	+ Palo Alto Panorama and Prisma
	+ Meraki WiFi and Switching
	+ Radware LB and WAF
	+ Decoding packet captures with Wireshark
	+ Testing and analyzing software releases impact to network security CVEs
	+ QoS design, loadbalancing, and data routing
	+ Monitoring/alerting tools like SolarWinds, LogicMonitor, ExtraHop
	+ Cloud infrastructure enviornments like Direct Connect, ExpressRoute, Transit Gateways, WAF and Firewalls in AWS and Azure
* CCNA and/or CCNP certifications with Collaboration
* CCDA and/or CCDP certifications with Collaboration

**Qualified applicants must also possess the following skills/competencies:*** Forward Thinking
* Leading and Inspiring People
* Working With a Team
* Planning and Organizing
* Problem Solving
* Persuading and Influencing
* Resilience
* Creativity

**Work from Home (WFH) Requirements:*** Must have reliable and consistent high-speed internet access provided by a terrestrial cable or fiber provider (no DSL or satellite)
* High-speed Internet connection with a minimum validated upload speed of 5Mb and download speed of 25Mb is required. Connection latency must be less than 100ms. (Please validate using a speed test tool such as http://www.speedtest.net/)

title: Network Engineer (DIET)
description:
GES is seeking qualified candidates to join our Defense Enclave Services (DES) team, who will support an extensive digital modernization program critical to DISA and Fourth Estate Agencies. The Network Engineer will work with various Product Owners to deliver new cloud service capabilities. The Senior Network Engineer will develop, configure, and deploy network services within the Azure Cloud and data centers to fulfill end user requirements. The Senior Network Engineer will participate in the development of user stories, sprint planning, and test case development / execution within an agile project environment. **Primary Responsibilities*** Designing, maintaining, and operating Local Area Networks (LANs) and Wide Area Networks (WANs), Wireless, Internet connectivity, utilizing Infrastructure as Code and Ansible Automation Platform.
* Automate network changes on across various vendor platforms and Azure Cloud.
* Azure Cloud Networking and Security Experience
* Experience in planning, designing and migration of DDI Services (InfoBlox)
* Experience in DHCP, DNS and IPAM Solutions as a Service
* Experience with ISE (Identity Service Engine)
* Assist multifunctional teams to help optimize and visualize network operations.
* Conduct data captures to obtain network performance information.
* Provide input to the design of the organization's network and mission architecture.
* Design solutions, integrate, configure, deploy, test and provide ongoing maintenance for numerous types of network devices, interfaces and methodologies.
* Have a significant role in the evaluation and support of network architectures across platforms to ensure alignment to cloud and network modernization strategies, capabilities and requirement sets.
* Participate in the day-to-day execution of the enterprise architecture strategy via agile release schedules utilizing DevOps and CI/CD tool sets.
* Work across multiple projects and systems to develop user stories, test cases, system design document, implementation plans, and SOPs.
* Understanding technical security best particles and guidelines. Knowledge of and experience with security policies, network security, data security and security event management.
 **Basic Qualifications*** Experience architecting/deploying/operating solutions software defined networking.
* Experience with DevOps principles and Automation Platforms such Cisco DNA, Palo Alto Prisma and Ansible.
* Strong understanding of networking in the areas of LAN, WAN, TCP/UDP, IPSec, VPN, Proxies, Routing(L2/L3), Firewalls and Software Defined Networking.
* Strong scripting experience/background (using Python)
* Understanding of Federal Government application, server, and network security requirements such as FISMA, FedRAMP, and NIST.
* Candidate must possess strong written and verbal communication skills, a demonstrated ability to meet deadlines, a strong analytical ability.
* Expertise in the Atlassian tool suite, to include JIRA and Confluence
* Excellent written and oral communication skills
* Current IAT Level II or higher Certification such as Security + or CISSP
* Possess a current Secret clearance.
* Bachelor’s degree and 8+ years of experience; additional years of experience may be substituted in lieu of a degree.
 **Preferred Qualifications*** Demonstrate expertise in design and improvement of complex and geographically enterprise networks including geo-load balancing and datacenter network failover.
* Expert knowledge of DoD security requirements for network infrastructure.
* DOD Network Routing Experience
* Demonstrate experience in system hardening of network infrastructure to include DoD STIG implementation.
* Certified Cisco Network Professional (CCNP) or equivalent.
* Aruba Networking Experience
* Wireless Engineering Experience

title: Sr. Manager Network Services
description:
At Echo, we foster a culture that promotes continuous learning, innovation, and personal development. Apply today and grow with Echo!
The Sr. Manager Network Services will ensure the integrity and stability of all networking-based services. This will be achieved through taking a managing position in the installation, configuration, monitoring, maintaining, and supporting all routers, switches, firewalls that make up our internal MPLS, wireless, telecommunication services and data center networks, Cloud connections, and PTP VPN networks.
Reporting to the Director of IT Operations, The Senior Manager of Network Services will lead a team of advanced and entry level network engineers and technicians that are responsible for the resiliency and operational aspects of the Echo enterprise network. This will be a hands-on leadership role that will lead various transformative network and telecommunications initiatives (redesign, infrastructure upgrades, new build outs), both strategic and tactical in nature, that will address most important challenges including scalability, stability, and an increasingly complex unified communications environment, including data, voice, and video infrastructure. The Network Services Manager must maintain a detailed working knowledge of network technologies and understand how data moves between Clouds, SaaS Solutions and data center environments while adapting the network to meet the needs of Enterprise wide range of applications and systems.
Principal Accountability | Support* Manages the team that designs, configures, and monitors networking equipment in a redundant environment with real time failover.
* Manages the team that researches new technologies and best practices.
* Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations.
* Manages the scheduling and implementation of system maintenance to maximize the efficiency of IT efforts.
* Managing functional teams that manage voice operations which includes messaging, networking, and reporting, including local Public Switched Telephone Network (PSTN) services and long-distance services.
* Leading and mentoring Network Services professionals, fostering a high-performance team and encouraging professional growth.
* Collaborate with Information Security to ensure adherence to information security policies, guidelines and standards are met and implemented.
* Maximizes network performance by monitoring performance; troubleshooting network problems and outages; scheduling upgrades; collaborating with network architects on network optimization.
* Provide support on a 24x7 basis as required.
* Principal Accountability | Projects
* Taking direction from IT management; design and document project plans
* Manages the building, execution, and analyses of proof-of-concept projects.
* Prioritize multiple projects and operational support.
* Follow through with projects to their completion.
* Partners with Security to ensure compliance and enforcement of Security Guidelines
* Principal Accountability | Team Member
* Open to new ideas and encourages innovative practices amongst peers.
* Practices positive interactions - leans on encouragement in place of judgment.
* Impresses responsibility on others by displaying ownership in tasks.
* Acts in the interest of the overall team.
* Actively works on broadening or adding skills.
* Asks for assistance when problems become challenging.
* Balances best practice decisions with delivering high business value
* Contributes to the success of the team.
* Able to multi-task in a fast paced, fluid work environment
* Capable of presenting technical ideas and concepts in business -friendly language


Position Requirements* Undergraduate Degree in Computer Science or related technical discipline or equivalent years of experience
* Excellent oral and written communication skills including technical documentation skills
* Self-managed and motivated
* Ability to follow through with tasks to their completion, organized, and detail oriented
* Willingness to learn new technologies.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Ability to thrive in an environment that requires frequent attention shifts from one project to the next.
* Proactive, self-starter able to work with limited supervision and prepared to take responsibility for the role's operations.
* Exceptional time and project management skills.


Technical Skills and Experience
Desirable:* Experience working with the following products: A10, PAL, Cisco 8500 SDWAN devices, and Nexus 9000 switches.
* Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP or CCDP) or equivalent required or equivalent field experience
* Cisco Certified Internetwork Engineer (CCIE) Certification Preferred


Required:* Understanding of BGP and routing protocols including OSPF
* Minimum 5 years of experience in all aspects of network administration utilizing Cisco iOS
* Experience with the Windows Server/Linux/AWS/KS8 Environments
* Prior experience building and managing P2P and SD-WAN network.
* 10+ years of experience in management of large-scale networks in a distributed environment.
* Strong understanding of network technologies in a design context, including LAN (traditional STP plus fabric), ACI, SD-WAN, BGP/OSPF, Tunneling (GRE, IPSec), wireless, cloud networking (public and private), QoS/shaping, GSLB, NetFlow/IPFIX, firewalls/WAF, IDS/IPS, NFV
* Experience with network management protocols and systems.
* Experience with Cisco networking technologies.
* Experience with wireless technologies.
* Experience with TCP/IP and common network protocols.
* Experience with routing, switching, and IP subnetting.
* Cloud Datacenter Connectivity (Azure, AWS) Direct Connect/Transit Gateway
