title: Senior Network Engineer
description:
Overview:

REI Co-op is united around discovering, building and celebrating better ways of working in this world, all so that folks can find and pursue a love of the outdoors. When you work for the co-op, you do your best work with the support to live your best life. And you play a part in shaping the future of the outdoors, for people and our planet.  

As a Senior Network Engineer, you will contribute to REI’s success by helping lead the architecture, design, development and implementation of enterprise-wide network infrastructure plans. You will evaluate new network technologies and topologies to meet current and projected business needs. You will assess the costs and benefits of proposed and existing Wide Area Network (WAN) services, Internet services and voice services covering 190 remote sites globally, 3 data centers, 4 distribution centers, and an ever-growing Cloud footprint.


You will be a part of the REI network team and report to the senior manager of network and unified communication services. If you thrive in an environment where innovation is part of everyday life, where excellence and high standards are the norm, where you can make a real impact while working on best of breed world-class technologies, then read on.


In this role, you will have the opportunity to:

* Lead enterprise-wide projects in relation to design and provisioning of network infrastructure and security components.
* Participate in strategy definition and execution for enterprise network segmentation to address high risk environments such as public facing cloud applications or backend systems and IoT.
* Participate in the definition of the technology roadmap for network security components such as firewalls, network access control, central policy management, and VPN services. Including emerging technologies, vendor selection, and engineering validation in labs.
* Translate business requirements by designing, implementing, and managing firewall policy based on internal standards as well as industry best practices.
* Resolve escalations for unique and complex technical problems that operational teams are unable to solve.
* Conduct complex incident management and problem resolution for network systems.
* Monitor network logs and perform corrective actions accordingly.

  


Responsibilities:
* Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field, or equivalent training and experience.
* 5+ years engineering experience or equivalent industry knowledge.
* Experience in networking field at a large enterprise scale including WAN, LAN, data center and cloud environments.
* Hands on experience with the Palo Alto and Fortinet firewall management.
* Proven expertise designing and supporting SD-WAN services in an enterprise environment.
* Ability to participate in on-call rotation for a 24x7 support.
* Hands-on with Aruba ClearPass network authentication service (NAC) engines.
* Experience with network automation tools such as Ansible, scripting using Terraform, Python, or other tools for automating changes on network/security devices at scale.
* Cloud automation and security including terraform.
* Wireless network design, support and troubleshooting.
* TCP/IP Stack
* Routing including BGP, OSPF, VXLAN
* Client and site-to-site vpn configuration/management experience
* DNS/DHCP troubleshooting
* Technical knowledge in a variety of IT infrastructure areas, ideally for a Retail company
* Strong leadership and communication skills along with the ability to collaborate across all groups and levels
* Ability to interface and coordinate work efficiently and effectively with business partners or vendors


Closing:
**At REI, we believe the outdoors is for all.** We are committed to becoming a fully inclusive, anti-racist, multicultural organization. We know that there's strength in our diversity – that each employee brings unique skills, experiences, and perspectives. Every day you are driving change, fostering a culture of respect, and knowing you're backed by benefits that support your whole life. To work towards this commitment and fulfill our brand promise of inspiring and enabling a life outside for everyone, we seek employees who demonstrate different ways of working, create a sense of belonging, and actively listen and learn. **Pay Transparency**


We are committed to practices that promote pay equity and transparency. As required by applicable Pay Transparency laws, REI provides a range of compensation for roles that may be hired in locations under these requirements. Factors that may be used to determine your actual salary may include a wide array of factors, including: your specific skills and experience, geographic location or other relevant factors.


REI offers all regular employees a generous employee discount, access to health benefits, a retirement savings plan and accrued time off. Click here for a detailed overview of benefits plans by employee profile.


Base Pay Range: USD $110,900.00 - USD $177,400.00 /Yr.

title: IP Network Engineer
description:
**IP Network Engineer**


**\\*\\*100% remote role, candidates can reside anywhere in the contiguous United States. However, this role requires travel on a "as needed" basis.**


**Communication Technology Services (CTS)** is building a next-gen (4G & 5G) managed service business to provide enterprise customers with a turnkey Private Cellular Network (PCN) for mission critical business applications and wireless connectivity needs.


The role of IP Network Engineer designs, implements, operates, and maintains IP network connectivity within and between CTS data centers, customer-premise-deployments and with partners.

  

  

**The ideal candidate has 5+ years of work experience,** is equally comfortable and effective in both **Linux (required)** and various network equipment Operating Systems, is able to independently engage a situation, gather information, make information-based decisions and communicate well with and across teams and with customers.


**Key Responsibilities**


* Design, Implementation, Operation and Maintenance of CTS’s IP Data Networks, within and between CTS Data Centers, customer-premise-deployments and partners
* (LAN/WAN/VPN/SD-WAN)
* Routing, Switching, Firewalling
* Internet connectivity including BGP multihoming, ASN administration, looking glass
* IP Planning and Address Space Allocation
* VPNs and tunneling, including IPSec
* VLANs in a virtualized environment (802.1q)
* VRF and policy routing
* NAT and load balancing
* Network security- IPS, DOS, Firewalls

**Qualifications**


* Expertise in design, implementation, operation and maintenance of LAN, WAN, VPN connectivity. SD-WAN experience desirable.
* Experience with a variety of network equipment vendors’ hardware and software (Cisco, Fortigate, Juniper, Mikrotik, etc.) is highly desirable.
* IP networking – IP addressing and subnetting, network address translation, routing protocols, Linux IP tables, Linux bridging.
* Proficiency in troubleshooting production issues, solving problems, and implementing updates to production hardware and software environments
* Analysis of packet captures to distinguish between problems at the protocol or  

application level vs. network connectivity.
* Understanding of internet protocols, including but not limited to, HTTP, DNS, RADIUS,  

SSH, and SMTP.
* Demonstrated experience in effective decision-making within a high-pressure 24×7 environment.
* Strong research, investigation and evaluation skill.
* Ability to identify and clearly communicate problems/support requests in order to influence the prioritization of production defects and/or enhancements
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Experience with Cacti and Nagios monitoring systems strongly desired.
* Relevant experience would include, DevOps, 24x7x365 operations, IP routing, ethernet switching, IP and Application load balancing, firewalls, IPv4, IPv6, participation in 24×7 on-call rotation.
* Good organizational and vendor management skills, inclusive of issue tracking, metric reporting, etc.
* Results-oriented and highly flexible, able to work with minimal supervision.

**Education & Certifications**


4 Year Technical Degree (Example: BSCS, BSEE, etc.) or equivalent workplace experience.


**Requirements**


* Ability to work outside of normal business hours when needed.
* Ability to travel on an “as needed” basis.

**Industry**


* Wireless Communications & Telecommunications
* Information Technology & Services

**Employment Type**


* Full-time
* Exempt

**Job Functions**


* Data Center Operations/Engineering
* Information Technology
* Job Category: IT/Networking

title: Network Engineering Manager
description:
**WHO WE ARE:**



EOS IT Solutions is a leading logistics, Network and Collaboration company. We support a large number of tech companies providing innovative solutions – globally. We have an immediate opening for a highly motivated, collaborative and committed individual to fill our Network Engineering Manager position within our Global Network Engineering team.

  


**POSITION OVERVIEW:**



 As our Network Engineering Manager, you will play a critical role in leading a team of network professionals to deliver high quality, available, redundant services according to our customer requirements. The Network Engineering Manager provides leadership, technical oversight, planning, and coordination. The Manager will provide mentoring, professional development, and career advancement opportunities to direct reports across the globe and ensure that direct reports are contributing and performing effectively. This Position is Hybrid to Austin, TX.


**Required skills:**

  

* 3+ years' experience as network manager
* Experience implementing, managing and delivering within SLAs
* Strong understanding of network infrastructure and network hardware
* Experience troubleshooting network devices
* Experience in working in a multi-partner environment
* Experience in growing a team of network talent
* Ability to engage with a wide range of customers and experience levels
  


**Key responsibilities & duties include:**

  

* Managing the outcomes of the network engineer and technical delivery engineers
* Manage vendor and partner relationships
* Work closely with the pre-sales team and Network Lead on designs, budgets and framework
* Ensure SLA's and OLA's are met and reported to the business
* Represent Networks on operational boards
* Team and talent development
* Supporting delivery and operation where necessary
* Maintain continuity, capacity and compliance
  


**Desirable skills:**

  

* Network certification (e.g. CCNP / CCIE) advantageous
* Strong understanding of network infrastructure and network hardware
* Ability to communicate effectively at different levels
* Ability to create accurate network diagrams and documentation for design and planning network communication systems
* Provides specific detailed information for hardware and software selection
* Ability to quickly learn new or unfamiliar technology and products using documentation and internet resources
* Ability to work with all levels of staff within different business units in the company
* A self-starter able to work independently but comfortable working in a team environment
* Good analytical and problem-solving skills
* Dependable and flexible when necessary
* Experience on Network security, LAN and WAN
* Network Engineering or Delivery experience
* Commercial experience
* Experience in team development and training
* Experience in regulated environments and critical infrastructure environments
* Experience in Hybrid Cloud and Network Automation
  





**Pay Range**


$100,000—$100,000 USD

title: Pre-Sales Network Systems Engineer
description:
**WHO WE ARE:**



EOS IT Solutions is a supply chain animal that has a legacy of execution with some of the largest, most demanding companies on the planet. EOS have strong global logistics roots coupled with the ability to deliver networking solutions & hybrid work experiences all over the world. We have an immediate opening for a highly motivated, collaborative, and committed individual to fill our Network Pre-Sales System Engineer position within our Global Sales team


**POSITION OVERVIEW:**



We are seeking a passionate and high energy pre-sales engineer who's looking to take their next step in their career. The ideal candidate will have a strong foundation in enterprise networking and a flair for either data center, optical, or security technologies. In this role you will build strong customer relationships and help drive key deals in global accounts.



The successful candidate will be enthusiastic and passionate about IT and Networking. Working as part of an expanding company, members of the team will have opportunities to work on their own initiative as well as part of a team and can expect to be developed to their maximum of their potential.


**WHAT YOU'LL DO:**



You get to bring your passion for technology coupled with execution to a global set of customers. Day to day responsibilities will include actively participating in customer sales meetings, driving presentations of technical solutions, white boarding, custom technical design, and properly scoping out services related work. The SE will team with their sales counterparts to build and nurture customer relationships, partner with multiple OEM's and regularly seek to find areas of value for our customers. Technical expertise expansion is highly encouraged as you look to learn about new areas of interest and be on the forefront of cutting-edge technologies.  

  

***Travel 25-30% expected.***


**WHAT YOU'LL NEED TO SUCCEED**


* Demonstrate strong understanding of some or all of the following technologies: Software defined architecture, (SD-WAN , SD-LAN) Data centre technologies (ACI, VMware, VDI etc) Security solutions (NGFW, ZTN, SASE) and knowledge of Cloud solutions (AWS, AZURE, GCP etc)
* Familiarity with major networking vendors, e.g. Cisco, Juniper, Arista, HPE-Aruba, Palo Alto Networks, etc
* Adept at using initiative, discretion, and judgment to apply technical solutions to complex sales opportunities.
* Ability to translate design requirements into BOMs and partnering with procurement to generate quotes
* Experience of customer interactions with technical staff.
* Knowledge of sales cycle.
* Impactful verbal and written communication and good presentation skills.
* Great relationship building skills, tenacity, resilience.
* Ability to work independently and remotely as well as with your team to accomplish objectives.
* Good understanding of the market space and offerings.
* Previous experience working for a VAR is ideal


**PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:**


* Solid understanding of technologies such as campus networking (L2/L3), SDx & programmability, datacentre& cloud, collaboration, and security.
* Strong industry knowledge and operational empathy
* 5+ yrs of pre-sales engineering or related experience
* Preferably have, CCNP or CCIE (JNCIE) certifications.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Write and speak English fluently.
* Most of all a team player with a passion of technology and the impact it can make on our customers businesses, someone who helps others, likes to get involved, and have fun
 **Pay Range**


$180,000—$200,000 USD

title: SR Network Engineer, I
description:
Fueled by our shared passion and expertise, CDW delivers innovative technology solutions for our customers. We’re also committed to fostering an environment that embraces collaboration, celebrates integrity, inclusivity, and individuality, and paves the path for personal and professional growth. Experience a life in balance and join us on the journey forward.



The Senior Network Engineer installs, configures, deploys, tests, maintains, monitors, and troubleshoots CDW’s global network and firewall components to provide a robust network communications platform. Partcipates in the implementation, capacity planning, and optimization of CDW’s network and firewall infrastructure. This engineer applies expert experience, knowledge and skills to deliver secure, fault tolerant, scalable, and flexible infrastructure for CDW’s operations, supports and troubleshoots network and application problems, coordinates implementations with CDW staff and vendor personnel and is a knowledgeable resource for other Network Engineers.



**What you will do:**

* Develops configuration plans for network and firewall systems.
* Specific responsibilities include design, installation, configuration, administration, upgrade, maintenance, and documentation of complex Cisco switches, routers, wireless, VPN, ASA firewalls, Palo Alto firewalls, F5 LTM & GTM Load Balancers, and Cisco Viptela SDWAN solutions.
* Lead major network projects to support capacity growth, upgrades, new products/features, and integration.
* Acts as tier 1 through tier 4 support for all network issues; participates in on-call rotation. Must be available to work frequently during evenings and weekends. Up to 25% domestic and international travel is required.
* Analyzes and resolves applicable hardware, software, and communications problems using diagnostic software and/or technical troubleshooting processes.
* Creates and maintains documentations of Standard Operating Procedure’s and other process documentation.
* Secures network systems by enforcing policies.
* Works closely with other departments/organizations and collaborates with other IT staff. Provides training and technical support for users with varying levels of IT knowledge and competence.
* Coordinates with management for the acquisition of and contracting for hardware, software, and information technology services (including maintenance) for all network routing, switching, wireless, and firewall infrastructure.




**What we expect of you:**

* High School Diploma or equivalent
* 5 years of Information Technology Engineering experience.
* 3 years of SDWAN experience in an enterprise and data center environment.
* Proficient in the creation and management of network documentation.
* Monitoring tool experience required.
* Experience with change management control policies and tools.
* Strong analytical, organizational and interpersonal skills.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills.
* Minimum 5 years- experience is required with Cisco IOS, VPN Concentrators, ASA/FirePower, Routers, WLAN, Switches, Palo Alto Firewalls and F5 Load balancers.
* Strong hands-on knowledge of network/internet protocols/services such as TCP/IP model, MPLS, VPLS, Ethernet, VXLAN, MST, VRRP, OSPF, EIGRP, MP-BGP, DNS, DHCP, IPSec, VRF, and NAT.
* A College degree in a technical track is a plus
* Familiarity with scripting, deployment, and debugging using Python & Terraform, is a plus
* One or more of the following are preferred: Cisco ENSDWI, CCDP, CCNP or CCNP-SP, Palo Alto Certification ((PCNSE/PSNSA/PCCSE)), Microsoft Azure Certification, is a plus
* 8+ years’ experience in a technical engineering role, is a plus


**About us**  

**We make technology work so people can do great things.**



CDW is a Fortune 500 technology solutions provider to business, government, education, and healthcare organizations across the globe. At CDW, we make it happen, together. Trust, connection and commitment are at the heart of how we work together to deliver for our customers. It’s why we’re coworkers, not just employees. Coworkers who genuinely believe in supporting our customers and one another. We collectively forge our path forward with a level of commitment that speaks to who we are and where we’re headed. We’re your long-term, full-stack, full-lifecycle technology partner. We have the experience, expertise, scale, relationships and deep industry knowledge to bring just about any vision to life. Together, we can deliver the full promise of what technology can do. Together, we Make Amazing Happen.



All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

title: Specialist Information Systems Engineer – Network Engineering
description:
**HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?**


You’ve worked hard to become the professional you are today and are now ready to take the next step in your career. How will you put your skills, experience and passion to work toward your goals? At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide. Come do your best work alongside other innovative, driven professionals in this meaningful role.


Specialist Information Systems Engineer – Network Engineering

**Live**
--------

**What you will do**


Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment where troubleshooting complex network issues is your daily bread and butter? If you're a skilled Network Engineer with expertise in routing, switching, WANs, wireless, IPAM, DNS, DHCP, Infoblox, and F5 load balancing, and you're passionate about leveraging AI/ML and automation to streamline network operations, then we want to hear from you!


Amgen is seeking a Specialist Network Engineer responsible for the security, compliance, and performance of our network infrastructure. You will work with a team of dedicated network engineers and architects, who are accountable for security, compliance, and performance. You will also collaborate with other IT teams, such as Data Center Operations, Information Security, Service Management, and Internal Business Partners, to ensure alignment and integration of network solutions with business objectives. You will also support vendor relationships, contracts, and service-level agreements.

**Key Responsibilities for a Specialist Information Systems Engineer – Network Engineering:**

* Manage and maintain our complex network infrastructure, including routing, switching, WANs, wireless, IPAM, DNS, and DHCP.
* Configure and troubleshoot Infoblox DDI appliances and F5 load balancers.
* Monitor network performance and proactively identify and resolve potential issues.
* Implement and maintain network automation solutions to streamline operations and improve efficiency.
* Leverage AI/ML tools for network monitoring, anomaly detection, and predictive maintenance (a plus).
* Stay up to date on the latest network technologies and trends.
* Collaborate effectively with other IT teams to ensure seamless network operations.
* Document network configurations and procedures.
* Provide excellent customer service to internal and external partners.
* Identify and address potential network issues, providing solutions and recommendations.
* Travel: Domestic and international travel up to 15% may be essential

**Win**
-------

**What we expect of you**


We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The professional we seek is a candidate with these qualifications.

**Basic Qualifications:**
-------------------------


Doctorate degree

**Or**
------


Master’s degree and 2 years of Information Systems and Data Center Architect experience

**Or**
------


Bachelor’s degree and 4 years of Information Systems and Data Center Architect experience

**Or**
------


Associate degree and 8 years of Information Systems and Data Center Architect experience

**Or**
------


High school diploma/GED and 10 years of Information Systems and Data Center Architect experience

**Preferred Qualifications:**
-----------------------------

* Minimum 3 years of experience as a Network Engineer in a fast-paced environment.
* Strong understanding of routing, switching, WANs, wireless, IPAM, DNS, DHCP, Infoblox DDI, and F5 load balancers.
* Experience with network automation tools (e.g., Ansible, Puppet, Terraform) is a plus.
* Working knowledge of AI/ML concepts and their application in network operations (a plus).
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Good communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

**Thrive**
----------

**What you can expect of us**


As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being.


Amgen offers a Total Rewards Plan comprising health and welfare plans for staff and eligible dependents, financial plans with opportunities to save towards retirement or other goals, work/life balance, and career development opportunities including:

* Comprehensive employee benefits package, including a Retirement and Savings Plan with generous company contributions, group medical, dental and vision coverage, life and disability insurance, and flexible spending accounts.
* A discretionary annual bonus program, or for field sales representatives, a sales-based incentive plan
* Stock-based long-term incentives
* Award-winning time-off plans and bi-annual company-wide shutdowns
* Flexible work models, including remote work arrangements, where possible

**Apply now**
-------------

**for a career that defies imagination**


Objects in your future are closer than they appear. Join us.

**careers.amgen.com**
---------------------


Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.


We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

title: Senior Network Engineer
description:
**Summary:**  

  

K2 Services is seeking an experienced Senior Network Engineer with advanced skills in Fortinet with global, enterprise experience, and a willingness to learn Palo Alto and Arista switches. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, implementing, and managing complex networks, ensuring high performance, scalability, and security. This role involves providing technical leadership, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and driving initiatives to optimize network architecture.

* Provide technical leadership and mentorship to junior network engineers.

* Design and implement complex routing and switching solutions using Cisco or Arista switches.

* Responsible for change management procedures and detailed ownership, planning, and execution of highly complex, secure, high risk, multifaceted changes.
* Provide technical guidance and leadership to project teams and individuals as appropriate.

**Requirements:*** Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field.
* 10+ year's experience in a large multi-platform environment or equivalent technical experience.
* Proven experience with Fortinet Secure SD-WAN.
* Proven experience with Fortinet Secure Access Service Edge (SASE).
* Proven experience with Fortinet Cloud Access Security broker (CASB).
* of networking protocols, security, and infrastructure.
* Strong hands-on experience with Fortinet products.
* Fortinet Certified Solution Specialist Network Security.
* Excellent leadership, communication, and collaboration skills.
* Relevant certifications such as Fortinet Network Security Expert (NSE).
* Strong analytical\\trouble shooting skills with extensive work experience; experience in providing situational analysis for networking\\telecommunications.
* Strong verbal and written communication.
* Excellent customer orientation, support, and interfacing experience with ability to persuade, convince, or influence others to take appropriate action.
* Ability to lead and impact others at all levels of the organization.
* Proven success in dealing with concurrent problems and issues effectively in a dynamic, high-pressure environment.
* Advanced understanding of business strategy as it relates to network environment.

**Preferred Skills:*** Experience with virtualization technologies.
* Familiarity with cloud networking solutions.
* Knowledge of Software-Defined Networking (SDN) concepts.
* Scripting or automation skills for network-related tasks.

title: Senior Network Engineer
description:
**About Peraton**  

Peraton is a next-generation national security company that drives missions of consequence spanning the globe and extending to the farthest reaches of the galaxy. As the world's leading mission capability integrator and transformative enterprise IT provider, we deliver trusted, highly differentiated solutions and technologies to protect our nation and allies. Peraton operates at the critical nexus between traditional and nontraditional threats across all domains: land, sea, space, air, and cyberspace. The company serves as a valued partner to essential government agencies and supports every branch of the U.S. armed forces. Each day, our employees do the can't be done by solving the most daunting challenges facing our customers. Visit peraton.com to learn how we're keeping people around the world safe and secure.  

**Responsibilities**  

  

Peraton is seeking a **Senior Network Engineer** to join our team of qualified, diverse individuals. The ideal candidate will support the United States Citizen and Immigration Services (USCIS) in maintaining its information technology (IT) enterprise infrastructure. This individual will have a background in Dev Ops concepts.
  

  

Remote role. Must be local to the DC Metro area.
  

  

**Day to Day Work Responsibilities:**  

  

* Design, implement, and manage scalable and secure network architectures.
* Ensure the integration of new technologies into existing network structures.
* Configure and manage routers, switches, firewalls, and other networking devices.
* Implement and optimize routing protocols and VLANs.
* Collaborate with the security team to integrate security measures into the network design.
* Monitor network security, identifying and addressing vulnerabilities.
* Optimize network performance for high availability, reliability, and scalability.
* Troubleshoot and resolve complex network-related issues.
* Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements.
* Maintain detailed documentation of network configurations, changes, and troubleshooting steps.

**Qualifications**  

  

**Basic Qualifications:**  

  

* U.S. Citizenship and must have the ability to obtain a DHS Entrance on Duty (EOD) clearance.
* Bachelor's degree in an Engineering Discipline and 12 years' experience or Master's degree and 10 years' experience.

* Strong critical thinking, complex problem solving, appropriate judgment, and decision-making skills.

title: WIRELESS ENGINEER
description:
Description:  

Looking for **two FTE** Wireless Engineers. Wireless engineers will engineer, design, implement and troubleshoot wireless data systems to include Juniper and Cisco systems across the county in VA owned and leased spaces. Projects will include enhancements to security, transition to IPv6, automation, design, and configuration planning of new equipment. They will lead implementations with multiple VA teams to accomplish mission goals. This LCAT has been identified as resident engineer. Resident engineer must meet the following requirements:


1. Expertise with Cisco and Juniper wireless systems


2. Expertise with designing, implementing, and troubleshooting enterprise level large, multi-site, multi-vendor wireless systems .


3. Expertise in deployment automation, vulnerability remediations, updates and configuration of wireless systems


4. Expertise with oversight of a team running a trouble ticket system.


5. Demonstrated success using modern DevOps methods and tools including automated testing tools and monitoring tools.

7. Minimum Education Level


a. Current CCIE Wireless Certification **IS A PLUS, BUT NOT REQUIRED**


b. Current JNCIA-MISTAI Certification **IS A PLUS, BUT NOT REQUIRED**


8. Minimum 15 years’ experience as wireless engineer spanning multiple locations.


Requirements:

 The role consisted of 75% remote, 25% Travel.

title: Remote Upgrades Engineer
description:
**This is where you save and sustain lives**

At Baxter, we are deeply connected by our mission. No matter your role at Baxter, your work makes a positive impact on people around the world. You’ll feel a sense of purpose throughout the organization, as we know our work improves outcomes for millions of patients.


Baxter’s products and therapies are found in almost every hospital worldwide, in clinics and in the home. For over 85 years, we have pioneered significant medical innovations that transform healthcare.


Together, we create a place where we are happy, successful and inspire each other. This is where you can do your best work.


Join us at the intersection of saving and sustaining lives— where your purpose accelerates our mission.

**Your Role at Baxter**
-----------------------

**THIS IS WHERE you build trust to achieve results!**


Care Communications is a division of Baxter passionate about delivering clinical communication, workflow automation, and groundbreaking mobile communication strategies to healthcare facilities, Remote Upgrade Engineers are an integral part of the team.


The Remote Upgrades Engineer performs detailed assessments of existing Baxter Care Communications product installations in order to upgrade products to the latest available software packages. Upgrade assessments require detailed knowledge of software, hardware, network design and topology, network integrations, etc.


This is a full-time position where the working hours consist of Monday-Friday, 8:00 AM EST - 5:00 PM EST, where the candidate would conduct a remote model, working from home.

**What You'll Be Doing:**
-------------------------

* Lead and perform upgrades of Baxter Care Communications products. This primarily entails performing site assessments, upgrading applications on servers and proprietary devices/hardware, configuring system networks, and working with the customer’s IT team to understand other variables in their environment to complete upgrades
* Drive detailed technical discussions with internal teams and 3rd party partners regarding complex integrations as needed
* Ensure performance, quality, and reliability is validated post-upgrade for all Baxter Care Communications products
* Participate in multi-functional teams to tackle and resolve sophisticated issues
* Participate in teams driven toward continuous process improvement
* Candidates should possess strong oral, written communication skills

**What You'll Bring:**
----------------------

* Bachelor of Science in Engineering, Computer Science, or related field required or a minimum of 4 years equivalent experience in the software and/or networking fields plus two of the below certifications
* Strong collaboration and multi-functional interpersonal skills as this position consistently partners with R&D, project managers, and customers
* Required knowledge in two or more of the following areas to support business needs:
* SQL/Scripting/Reporting Engines/Analytics (SAS Crystal, etc.)
* Networking (TCP/IP, Routing, Switching, Security)
* Enterprise level hardware (Server/Client OS, SANS, RAID)
* Middleware (Rhapsody, etc.)
* HL7
* Microsoft Windows
* Linux, Kubernetes
* Wireless - Enterprise level/run networks
* Preferred Certifications in the following:
* CompTIA Network+, CCNA (or higher),CompTIA Security+, CompTIA, Linux+, CompTIA ITF, CompTIA A+, Certified Kubernetes Administrator, or LPI Linux Essentials
* Proficient knowledge of Microsoft Windows platforms, SQL, IIS server and other networked systems.
* Sophisticated understanding of deploying and supporting Linux based platforms (Kubernetes) and associated networked systems.
* Detailed knowledge of common network protocols / architecture (TCP/IP, IP routing, the OSI model, VLAN) and their relevant security issues
* Detailed knowledge of common network protocols/architecture (TCP/IP, IP routing, OSI model, VLAN, etc), client/server networking environments and standard processes, led switches, VOIP, and network security.
* Knowledge of WiFi wireless technologies with security protocols
* Basic VoIP and/or PBX telephony knowledge and basic configuration experience
* Experience configuring, setting up, and debugging Windows and Linux based systems


We understand compensation is an important factor as you consider the next step in your career. At Baxter, we are committed to equitable pay for all employees, and we strive to be more transparent with our pay practices. The estimated base salary for this position is $76,000 - $104,500 annually. The estimated range is meant to reflect an anticipated salary range for the position. We may pay more or less than of the anticipated range based upon market data and other factors, all of which are subject to change. Individual pay is based on upon location, skills and expertise, experience, and other relevant factors. For questions about this, our pay philosophy, and available benefits, please speak to the recruiter if you decide to apply and are selected for an interview.


The successful candidate for this job may be required to verify that he or she has been vaccinated against COVID-19, subject to reasonable accommodations for individuals with medical conditions or religious beliefs that prevent vaccination, and in accordance with applicable law.

**Equal Employment Opportunity**


Baxter is an equal opportunity employer. Baxter evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, disability/handicap status or any other legally protected characteristic.  

  

EEO is the Law  

EEO is the law - Poster Supplement  

Pay Transparency Policy

**Reasonable Accommodations**  

  

Baxter is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities globally. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please click on the link here and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information.

**Recruitment Fraud Notice**  

  

Baxter has discovered incidents of employment scams, where fraudulent parties pose as Baxter employees, recruiters, or other agents, and engage with online job seekers in an attempt to steal personal and/or financial information. To learn how you can protect yourself, review our Recruitment Fraud Notice.

title: NETWORK ENGINEER - Business Applications/DOD Azure SQL - Hybrid or Remote
description:
F-35 NETWORK ENGINEER - Business Applications/DOD Azure SQL
  
Subject Matter Expert - Hybrid / Remote Work Arrangement
  
Signing Bonus Eligible
  
  

Rollout Systems, founded in 2001, is a full-service services and information technology company specializing in enhanced organizational performance.
  
  

Rollout Systems is a customer-focused and results-oriented company that combines talent, creativity, and drive to assist our customers in meeting their goals. We provide personal attention rarely found today, enabling a one-of-a-kind customer/contractor experience.
  
  

Our corporate culture is built upon open communications and teamwork principles that keep a talented, tenured workforce in place; consistent quality services; proactive, out-of-the-box thinking, and the highest ethical values. We provide our employees the best of benefits, including but not limited to generous paid time off, education opportunities, and a matching 401k plan.
  
  

We believe in empowerment for success and providing the tools to do the best job for our customers. Our corporate values are transparent; we are open and honest with each other. ROLLOUT Systems supports the communities that help our customers. In every way, every day, at work or play, we support the Warfighter that keeps America the "Land of the Free."
  
  

Do you hold an active US government security clearance? Are you interested in work that gives you the opportunity to use your skills to solve complex problems? Would you like to join a team that encourages ingenuity and is mission driven? Would you like to join an organization that makes a difference for our warfighters and our citizens?
  
  

The Joint Strike Fighter (JSF) F-35 IT program support contract provides knowledge-based, information assurance and cybersecurity IT services to the F-35 Lightning II Joint Program Office (JPO). Our services include program management, enterprise performance management, enterprise architecture, implementation of emerging capabilities and requirements, life cycle management, operations & maintenance, enterprise data management, service desk support and IT training.
  
  

Business Applications/DOD Azure SQL Network Engineer Job Duties:
  
  

Provides technical expertise supervising, monitoring, and troubleshooting information system network operations.
  
  

Senior level Business Application migration position serving as a subject matter expert for approximately one year. Length of assignment will be determined by project. This is a W2 employment position.
  
  

**Responsibilities include:**  

* Combine technical expertise in Azure, networking, and database management to ensure seamless connectivity, security, and performance within the Azure ecosystem in a project focused on conversion of systems to the Cloud.
* Assist in evaluating and deploying solutions to support modern authentication
* Identifying security risks to customer systems and suggest mitigations
* Professionally and effectively communicate; both verbal and written at all levels within the organization
* Ability to think analytically, troubleshoot, and solve problems
* Ability to troubleshoot and resolve network/application/operating system issues
* Self-starter, able to work independently with minimum supervision
* Excellent MS-Windows Server administration & maintenance skills
* Excellent oral and written communication skills
* Excellent analytical and troubleshooting skills


**The Network Engineer:**  

Troubleshoots network performance issues. Monitors and responds to complex technical control facility hardware, software, and network problems. Performs system-level design and configuration of products including determination of hardware, OS, and other platform specifications. Utilizes software and hardware tools and identifies and diagnoses complex problems and factors affecting network performance. Troubleshoots network systems when necessary and makes improvements to the network. Interfaces with vendor support service groups to ensure proper escalation during outages or periods of degraded system performance.
  
  

**Minimum Education Required:**  

* BS/BA degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or related IT discipline.


**Minimum Experience Required:**  

* Six (6) years of experience in an enterprise LAN/MAN/WAN environment.
* Four (4) years of experience in network administration and analysis.
* Experience working with appropriate complex network administration and maintenance.
* Experience working with complex system implementations and organizational processes to include maintaining network system documentation.
* Experience maintaining the integrity and security of networks and connected systems.
* Experience evaluating vendor products and making recommendations to purchase hardware, software, and coordinating installation.
* Experience in developing and monitoring policies and standards related to the use of computing resources.
* Experience in developing and implementing testing strategies and documenting results.


IAT Level III baseline certification in accordance with DoD 8140, Information Assurance Workforce Improvement Program to include accompanying intermediate level operating system certification, not training certificate.
  
  

**Security Clearance:** Top Secret clearance based upon a SSBI or SSBI-PR completed within the past five years.
  
  

About Rollout Systems
  
  

Are you interested in working for a smaller company as part of a team where everyone knows your name, and works with you to develop and track your career by providing you the opportunity to further your education, pursue cutting-edge industry certifications, and use your skills and experience on the job to solve complex problems?
  
  

Would you like to join a mission-driven team, makes a difference, and has an outstanding community reputation? A company that:
  
  

* Encourages and rewards referrals
* Encourages ingenuity
* Brings the entire company together quarterly for all-hands meetings to talk about our successes, what the company is doing and where we're going
* Highly accessible Human Resources and management support


Rollout Systems, founded in 2001, has celebrated over twenty wonderfully successful years! We are an agile government technical services provider delivering cost-effective solutions in our rapidly changing technology and warfare landscapes. We specialize in enhanced organizational performance and focus on success for both our employees and our customers. Our partnerships and reputation are the keys to our success. Our workforce consists of fully qualified, industry-certified, and active DOD-cleared professionals. COVID restrictions and requirements are available from Human Resources and program management.
  
  

In every way, every day, at work or play,
  
  

we support the Warfighter that keeps America the "Land of the Free".
  
  

Rollout Systems is a Veteran-friendly employer.
  
  

Rollout Systems is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer.
  
  

We value diversity in the workplace. All employment is decided based on qualifications, merit and business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, gender, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, age, physical, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, veteran status to include past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-300.5(a) and 60-741.5(a) which prohibits discrimination against qualified individuals.”

title: IS Network Engineer
description:
**HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?**


You’ve worked hard to become the professional you are today and are now ready to take the next step in your career. How will you put your skills, experience and passion to work toward your goals? At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide. Come do your best work alongside other innovative, driven professionals in this meaningful role.

**IS Network Engineer**

**Live**
--------

**What you will do**


Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this vital role you will work with a team of talented network engineers and architects, who are accountable for security, compliance, and performance. You will also collaborate with other IT teams, such as Data Center Operations, Information Security, Service Management, and Internal Business Partners, to ensure alignment and integration of network solutions with business objectives. You will also support vendor relationships, contracts, and service-level agreements.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Manage and maintain our complex network infrastructure, including routing, switching, WANs, wireless, IPAM, DNS, and DHCP.
* Configure and troubleshoot Infoblox appliances and F5 load balancers.
* Monitor network performance and proactively identify and resolve potential issues.
* Implement and maintain network automation solutions to streamline operations and improve efficiency.
* Stay up to date on the latest network technologies and trends.
* Document network configurations and procedures.
* Proactively identify and address potential network issues, providing solutions and recommendations.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills in English
* Travel: Domestic and international travel up to 15% may be essential

**Win**
-------

**What we expect of you**


We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The network professional we seek will have these qualifications.

**Basic Qualifications:**
-------------------------

**Master’s degree**
-------------------

**OR**


Bachelor’s degree and 2 years of Information Systems experience

**Or**
------


Associate degree and 6 years of Information Systems experience

**Or**
------


High school diploma/GED and 8 years of Information Systems experience

**Preferred Qualifications:**
-----------------------------

* Minimum 3 years of experience as a Network Engineer in a fast-paced environment.
* Strong understanding of Routing, Switching, WAN and SD-WAN, Wireless, Infoblox, and F5s.
* Experience with network automation tools (e.g., Ansible, Puppet, Terraform) is a plus.
* Working knowledge of AI/ML concepts and their application in network operations is a plus.
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

**Thrive**
----------

**What you can expect of us**


As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being.


Amgen offers a Total Rewards Plan comprising health and welfare plans for staff and eligible dependents, financial plans with opportunities to save towards retirement or other goals, work/life balance, and career development opportunities including:

* Comprehensive employee benefits package, including a Retirement and Savings Plan with generous company contributions, group medical, dental and vision coverage, life and disability insurance, and flexible spending accounts.
* A discretionary annual bonus program, or for field sales representatives, a sales-based incentive plan
* Stock-based long-term incentives
* Award-winning time-off plans and bi-annual company-wide shutdowns
* Flexible work models, including remote work arrangements, where possible

**Apply now**
-------------

**for a career that defies imagination**


Objects in your future are closer than they appear. Join us.

**careers.amgen.com**
---------------------

title: Advanced Wireless and Network Engineer
description:
Responsibilities:

We are seeking a talented and experienced Network Engineer to join our dynamic IT team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining our client organizations’ network infrastructure, including switching, routing, and wireless. This role requires a strong understanding of multiple technologies and the ability to deploy and manage complex networks to ensure reliable wired and wireless connectivity and optimal performance. The candidate should possess excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams to deliver innovative solutions that meet business requirements. **This position can work remote but must provide onsite support as needed to our clients in the Phoenix, AZ metro area.**
Qualifications:
* Experience in designing, implementing, and managing wireless network solutions in enterprise environments.
* Experience in designing, implementing, and managing wired LAN solutions in enterprise environments.
* Proficiency configuring, deploying, and upgrading Cisco Catalyst series switches, including but not limited to, 2k, 3k, and 9k series.
* Proficiency configuring, deploying, and upgrading Cisco routing platforms, including but not limited to, ISR 4k and Catalyst 8k platforms.
* Proficiency in configuring and troubleshooting wireless infrastructure, including RF planning, wireless security, and network protocols.
* Working knowledge of dynamic routing protocols, including EIGRP, OSPF, or BGP.
* Strong knowledge of Cisco wireless technologies, including Cisco Aironet access points, wireless LAN controllers, and/or Meraki wireless.
* Solid understanding of network protocols, including TCP/IP, DHCP, DNS, and VLANs.
* Experience in conducting wireless site surveys and implementing best practices for optimal coverage and performance.
* Experience deploying and using Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE) a plus.
* Experience in designing, implementing, and managing WAN solutions in enterprise environments a plus.
* Firewall experience, including managing security policies, NAT rules, and NGFW features a plus.
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills with the ability to identify and resolve complex technical issues.
* Effective communication and collaboration skills with the ability to work in a team environment.
* Cisco certifications such as CCNA, CCNP, or CCIE are preferred.
* Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field is preferred.
* The candidate must have a car, as this position requires travel between location and the transportation of equipment
* A valid driver’s license and proof of vehicle insurance will be required
* **Legally authorized to work in the US without sponsorship**
* Must demonstrate a “can-do” attitude

  

We focus on candidates that display our “ACE” factor – Attitude, Compassion, and Enthusiasm to deliver quality solutions with exceptional customer service.**What you get:**


We offer an energetic work environment with many corporate culture amenities, competitive salary, and rich benefit plan including: Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, 529, Life Insurance, Income Protection Short and Long-Term Disability, Medical and Child/Elder Care, Flexible Spending Account Plans, Employee Assistance Program, Two weeks vacation, additional paid time-off for Personal and Sick, certification and hands-on training, and discounts for local event entertainment and health clubs.

Since 1982, Sentinel has grown from providing technology maintenance services to our current standing as one of the leading IT services and solutions provider in the US. title: Senior Manager - Network
description:
US LBM is one of the leading and fastest growing distributors of specialty building materials in the United States, with a team of over 15,000 employees located throughout the country. Since our founding in 2009, we have acquired over 70 companies and have expanded to more than 500 locations serving 37 states. US LBM is a progressive organization that promotes a unique culture that focuses on the value of its customers and associates. Developing our people is critical to our strategy and fostering our culture of empowerment.  

  

The US LBM Senior Manager - Network is a pivotal position in US LBM that requires extensive expertise and effective leadership to ensure the seamless, secure, and efficient operation of US LBM's networks. This person will have broad experience managing 500+ network locations for a growing organization that is focused on service delivery and enhancing the end-user experience.  

  

**Essential Functions:**  

* Lead a talented team of network engineers, guiding them in world-class service delivery.
* Foster a culture of proactive optimization, driving initiatives to automate workflows, adopt cutting-edge technologies, and enhance network resilience, with a focus on SLA and SLOs.
* Collaborate with key stakeholders across the organization to align private cloud operations with business goals and growth plans.
* Analyze performance metrics, troubleshoot issues with surgical precision, and ensure network integrity at every turn.
* Implement and enforce robust security policies and procedures to safeguard our critical IT infrastructure.
* Champion innovative solutions, embrace automation, and contribute to shaping the future of USLBM's network ecosystem.
* Conduct regular assessments of industry trends and analyze business needs with stakeholders to develop new solutions or processes to improve operational efficiency or cost savings.
* Support and coach the network team on new concepts, procedures, and process improvement.
* Manage large outages acting as the central point of communications, distributing troubleshooting tasks, creating Root Cause Analysis reports, and developing countermeasures to future-proof against repeat outages.
* Manage all network-based changes including Hardware upgrades, Infrastructure modifications, Azure integrations, and implementing new tools and technologies in the Network Service Area.
* Develop, advise, monitor, and review new IT solutions that have an impact on the network services. This includes business application changes, backups' impacts on production networks, ISP, WAN and LAN based technologies.
* Work directly with the Network Security team to ensure neither network performance nor network security are compromised as each is independently optimized.
* Advise on service roadmaps which cover Disaster Recovery, modernizations of network elements, end of life upgrades, new technologies adoptions and financial forecasting.
* Adheres to Company's commitment to workplace safety.
* Perform other duties as assigned.
* Comply with all policies and standards.

  

**Education:**  

* Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field.

  

**Work Experience:**  

* 5+ years of experience in managing large-scale networks as a manager over a team of network engineers.
* Experience leading a team of 5-10 engineers covering 100+ network locations.
* Experience working on M&A efforts in the networking and infrastructure space.

  

**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:**  

* Strong knowledge of Network troubleshooting, incident management, and change management.
* Familiarity with full stack Meraki, Agent-based SASE, and Azure Networking
* Ability to support multiple efforts in parallel in a high matrix, fast-paced, multi-site organization experiencing rapid growth.
* Excellent presentation and interpersonal skills, including written and oral communication, with a demonstrated problem-solving and conflict-resolution history.
* MS Office experience required with a focused experience on MS Visio.

  

**Licenses and Certifications:**  

* CCNA is required
* Meraki is preferred
* Netskope is preferred
* Fortinet is preferred
* Juniper is preferred

  

**Competencies:**  

* Customer Focus - Building strong customer relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions
* Accountability - holding self and others accountable to meet commitments.
* Communicates Effectively - Developing and delivering multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences
* Decision Quality - Making good and timely decisions that keep the organization moving forward
* Being Resilient - Rebounding from setbacks and adversity when facing difficult situations
* Tech Savvy - Anticipating and adopting innovations in business-building digital and technology applications
* Collaborates - Building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives

  

US LBM Holdings, LLC, is an equal-opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin or ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability, veteran or military status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, military status, order of protection status, or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state, or local law.
